statement:
Let $B$ be a matrix defined on $T\times T$ for some countable set $T$.
If there exists a positive number $C$ such that
$$\sum_{t\in T}|b(s,t)|<C \ \text{for all\ }s\ \ \ \text{and} \ \ \  \sum_{s\in T}|b(s,t)|<C \  \text{for all\ } t,$$
then $B$ is a bounded operator on $l^2(T)$ with its operator norm
${\left\|B\right\|}$ less than or equal to $C$.

Let $x$ be a sequence in $l^2(T)$. We have $$\begin{aligned}
            {\left\|Bx\right\|}_2^2 & = \sum_{s\in T}\left|\sum_{t\in T}b(s,t)x(t)\right|^2\\
            &\leq
            \sum_{s\in T}\left[\sum_{t\in T}\sqrt{|b(s,t)|}\left(\sqrt{|b(s,t)|}|x(t)|\right)\right]^2\\
            &\leq
            \sum_{s\in T}\left[\left(\sum_{t\in T}|b(s,t)|\right)\left(\sum_{t\in T}|b(s,t)||x(t)|^2\right)\right]\\
            &\leq
            C\sum_{s\in T}\sum_{t\in T}|b(s,t)||x(t)|^2\\
            &\leq
            C\sum_{t\in T}|x(t)|^2\sum_{s\in T}|b(s,t)|\\
            &\leq
            C^2\sum_{t\in T}|x(t)|^2.
        \end{aligned}$$ Therefore we have
${{\left\|Bx\right\|}_2}\leq C{{\left\|x\right\|}_2}$ for all
$x \in l^2(T)$, hence ${\left\|B\right\|}\leq C$.
names: Schur's condition for a matrix to be a bounded operator on $l^2$
